title: Trailblazer League/Guide/Cooking

properties.name: description
properties.value: Cooking is heavily modified by all tier 1 relics.

content:
Trailblazer League
Guides

Overview[edit | edit source]

Main article: Pay-to-play Cooking training

Cooking is heavily modified by all tier 1 relics.

  • Endless Harvest greatly increases the speed at which players can obtain raw foods to cook.
  • Production Master allows players to cook an inventory of food instantly.
  • Skilling Prodigy reduces burn rates due to its visible level boost.

Training[edit | edit source]

Cooking gauntlets may be obtained by unlocking the Kandarin and Fremennik areas, due to the Fremennik area auto-unlocking Family Crest and Caleb being located in Catherby. The only raw foods available in Trailblazer League which are affected by the cooking gauntlets are raw sharks, raw monkfish, raw swordfish, and raw lobster. Raw karambwan burn rates are unchanged. Refer to the burn rate article for more information.

Jug of wine will be difficult to create without also unlocking the Humidify spell in the Fremennik area. Without Humidify players would have to manually create jugs of water or obtain them as drops from the Abyssal Sire, since shops only sell empty jug packs and do not sell jug of water packs.

See the Fishing guide regarding obtaining raw fish to cook.

The following table contains common locations to train the Cooking skill:

Region Location Distance to bank Notes
Misthalin✓ Lumbridge Castle range 22 Offers the reduced burn rates of a range and a further reduction in burn rates for certain foods, notably for raw shrimp, raw anchovies, raw trout, raw salmon, raw tuna, and raw karambwan.
Karamja✓ Mor Ul Rek Inner City sulphur vent 0 Requires a fire cape. A sulphur vent is adjacent to the inner city's bank chest.
Asgarnia✓ Rogues' Den fire 0 A fire is adjacent to the banker Emerald Benedict. Players should note that burn rates are higher on fires than stoves.
Kandarin✓
AND
Fremennik✓		 Myths' Guild range 0 Requires both areas unlocked. A stove is adjacent to the bank chest, making it better than the Rogues' Den fire or Mor Ul Rek's sulphur vent because stoves offer reduced burn rates.

Other equipment[edit | edit source]

Item Region Notes
Cooking gauntlets Kandarin✓AND Fremennik✓ Reduces burn rates for raw shark, raw monkfish, raw swordfish, and raw lobster.
Humidify Fremennik✓ Jugs of water can be obtained in Misthalin by manually filling empty jugs or slaying the Abyssal Sire, however they are time consuming to obtain without the Humidify spell. These are used with grapes to create jugs of wine, as a popular Cooking training method.

Temporary boosts[edit | edit source]

Item Region Notes
Spicy stew (orange spice) Desert✓ Boosts Cooking by ±0-5. Requires manual completion of the Freeing Evil Dave subquest in Recipe for Disaster.
Chef's delight Misthalin✓ Boosts Cooking by 1. Can be obtained from gourmet implings with level 28 Hunter. Otherwise requires the Morytania or Fremennik region to brew with level 54 Cooking.
Chef's delight(m) Morytania✓ Fremennik✓ Boosts Cooking by 2. Requires the Morytania or Fremennik region to brew with level 54 Cooking, more easily produced by using The stuff from Trouble brewing.

Skillcape[edit | edit source]

Item Region Master Notes
Cooking Cape Misthalin✓ Head chef Never burn while cooking.

{{TBL Guide Links}} ==Overview== {{Main|Pay-to-play_Cooking_training}} [[Cooking]] is heavily modified by all [[Trailblazer_League#Tier_1_relics|tier 1 relics]]. * [[Endless Harvest]] greatly increases the speed at which players can obtain raw foods to cook. * [[Production Master]] allows players to cook an inventory of food instantly. * [[Skilling Prodigy]] reduces burn rates due to its visible level boost. ==Training== [[Cooking gauntlets]] may be obtained by unlocking the Kandarin and Fremennik areas, due to the Fremennik area auto-unlocking [[Family Crest]] and [[Caleb]] being located in [[Catherby]]. The only raw foods available in [[Trailblazer League]] which are affected by the [[cooking gauntlets]] are [[raw shark]]s, [[raw monkfish]], [[raw swordfish]], and [[raw lobster]]. [[Raw karambwan]] burn rates are unchanged. Refer to the [[burn rate]] article for more information. [[Jug of wine]] will be difficult to create without also unlocking the [[Humidify]] spell in the Fremennik area. Without [[Humidify]] players would have to manually create [[jugs of water]] or obtain them as drops from the [[Abyssal Sire]], since shops only sell [[empty jug pack|empty jug packs]] and do not sell jug of water packs. See the [[Trailblazer_League/Guide/Fishing#Training|Fishing guide]] regarding obtaining [[raw fish]] to cook.
